intro: Anthospermum bergianum, commonly known as the Bergian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
